title: Master Dashboard: Dynamic Charts & Filtering
subtitle: Experience sales funnels, performance rankings, and other dynamic charts in just three steps, and master powerful data filtering capabilities.

steps.title: Start Your Data Exploration Journey
steps.description: Welcome to the dashboard! This is your data cockpit, aggregating all key business information for a clear overview.

steps.title: Step 1: Lead Insights
steps.description: First, let's dive into the "Lead Analytics" dashboard to see how to quickly gain business insights through visual charts.

steps.title: Interactive Data View
steps.description: Charts are not static. Hover over any part of the sales funnel to interactively view detailed data for that stage.

steps.title: Step 2: Create Dynamic Filters
steps.description: For more precise analysis, let's add a filter to the dashboard to make data queries more flexible.

steps.title: Add Filter Block
steps.description: Below the charts, you can easily add a filter block to serve as a controller for the data dashboard.

steps.title: Configure Filter Fields
steps.description: First, we need to define the filter criteria. For example, select the "Owner" field to filter data by salesperson.

steps.title: Link Filter Actions
steps.description: Then, associate this filter with the charts on the page, allowing filter operations to actually control chart display.

steps.title: Apply Filter and View Results
steps.description: Now, try filtering by an owner - all charts on the dashboard will update instantly based on your selection.

steps.title: Step 3: Customize Charts
steps.description: If the preset charts don't meet your needs, you can customize charts at any time.

steps.title: Go to "Account Insights" Page
steps.description: Let's switch to the "Account Insights" page, where charts can be configured more freely.

steps.title: Open Chart Configuration
steps.description: In configuration mode, each chart has a configuration button in the top right corner. Click it to start your customization journey.

steps.title: Switch Chart Type
steps.description: You can choose the most suitable presentation form from the rich chart library. For example, let's change it from a pie chart to a bar chart.

steps.title: Group by Color
steps.description: For deeper analysis, we can add a dimension to the chart, such as color grouping by "Customer Level".

button.label: Group by Type, Color Changes with Type

steps.title: Save Chart Settings
steps.description: When satisfied with the configuration, click "OK" to save the changes.

steps.title: View the Refreshed Chart
steps.description: Look! The chart has been successfully updated according to your requirements, and you can now analyze customer data from a new dimension.
